text: Beautiful golden color, the smell is yest, wheaty, the taste is very bitter, very hoppy. Not very malty, needs a little more ABV but at good beer.

Bottle: &nbsp Let me just start by saying that Founders can seemingly do no wrong. &nbsp This is one of those examples where you cross two styles and it works, works well. &nbsp Vibrant straw in color, perhaps a tinge of orange, nice moderate to large foamy off-white head, with nice lacing. &nbsp Sweet bready aroma, light, almost grassy but not quite. &nbsp Smooth on the tongue, well balanced, even a bit chewy. &nbsp Its like the best of both worlds, slightly hoppy but the body of a rich lager. &nbsp Big thanks to pailhead for sending one my way. &nbsp Generally not a big fan of the style, but this one drinks way too easy. &nbsp Its a bit warming too which aint bad at all. &nbsp Great beer!
Maybe a touch past its prime. Like a big thick Pilsner, still with some spicy and grassy hops, clean sweet leaning grainy malt. Full body for this style. I like, but didnt love it.
Pours a hazy gold color. Thin white head. Some lacing. Aroma is a bit perfume like. Biscuit like malt character with an earthy hop finish.

Poured from a bomber. Slightly cloudy pale yellow. White foamy head dissipates quickly. Heavy tropical fruit aroma-mango and peach plus some pepper and earth. Hops are fruity and spicy accompanied by moderately sweet malts. Bitterness is spot on - up front and center, but not bitey. Light fizz, smooth body. Nice beer.
Pours a deep golden yellow. Nice aromas of hops/citrus/peppery. Nice hoppy flavor, spicy/pepper, alcohol shows up in the back end.

Bottle aged for a year in my cellar. Clear, golden body. Frothy white head, rapidly diminishing. Aromas of toasted grain and alcohol. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finishes moderately sweet and moderately bitter, with a lingering bitterness. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation. Alcoholic from start to finish. Guess I should not have let this sit around too long.

Poured into a snifter.

4.0 A: Nearly clear peach color. One and a half fingers of frothy/creamy off-white head. Retention is about average and a healthy ring of lacing is left.

4.75 S: Any hint of a pilsner is gone. This is all about the hops. HUGE citrus aroma with mango then orange leading the way. Pineapple and a touch of lemon follow. Second to the citrus is pine and grapefruit. A touch of earthiness to finish it off. This smells awesome.

4.5 T: Again it just tastes like a DIPA albeit a very clean one. Tastes like it smells. Mild-moderate bitterness. If you concentrate you can almost taste the pilsner underneath.

4.25 M: Heavier medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Supremely smooth with just the slightest of bitter finish.

4.5 D: Pick this up. Its freakin good.

★ 803 characters


DavoleBomb, Oct 26, 2014

bomber pour..always excited to try a large bottle offering from this outfit because they know what they are doing..however this seems to be my least favorite of what they put out in a while..overly malty...not my cup of tea for style and just ok all around..wouldnt really recommend..bleh..

750 ml bottle. Pours a mostly clear and dark golden Amber color and topped by a small layer of off white foam that quickly fades to a thin film and leaves scant lines of lace around the glass. The aroma shows notes of pine, resin, orange peel and grapefruit hops, clean lager yeast and a toasted caramel and toffee malt base. The flavor follows with caramel, toffee, and buttery sweetness up front followed by citrus fruit and a floral and pine like bitterness from hop profile. The lager yeast keeps things clean and from getting overly sweet. Medium to full bodied and slick on the palate with balanced carbonation that leads to a clean, dry and bitter sweet finish with just a touch of heat from alcohol. This is a solid imperial pale lager, but just a little too heavy to really drink a ton of this.

Pours hazy straw gold with a fat and soapy white head that laces wetly. Aroma is lemon citrus with bread and sweet malts. Taste is similar. Veggie flavored and tangerine citrus upfront with a nice malt backbone and a dry bitter finish. Some booziness. Very flavorful.

På flarra. Jävlar vilken fräsch humlerik doft . Smakar fruktigt krämig känsla i munnen. Påminner om en Dipa jävlar i att. Fyllig IPL som slår ut alla andra jag testat. Rejäl fin mjuk efterbeska . Rejäl maktbas.. Ja jävlar god

Flaska. Buren från staterna. Underbart god IPL. Fina aromer där det ligger lite lagertoner som en skugga. Påminner mycket om dipor. Smaken bred något söt o maltig där humlen slår fint igenom. När jag känner efterbeskan så känns det att det finns inslag av lager.

Clear golden yellow color from the bottle with aromas of hay, grass and bright citrus hops. Flavors were grain and hay with a light citrus bite and hops. Nice lager qualities with some hoppi ess abv hidden well.
Very nice with some hops that bite. Rich hazy yellow. Goes very well with spicy food as it calms the palate from the spices. Bottle

Tap at Coopers. Cool crisp noble hops. Sweetness. Coop and crisp vegetal hop tones. Excellent lager tones. Really authentic feel amped up with better ingredients. A pretty spot on example of the style. Great mouthfeel. Nails it, easy drinking for the ABV.
Bomber shared by Bvery...thanks! Clear golden. Some hops, bready, citrus aroma. Taste follows, some tangerine. Decent brew.
Bomber. Slightly hazy golden pour with a white head. Tangerine, grain, sweet malt. A little bready. Tasty.
Bottle, shared with Parksy and the table at Radio Maria. Bright orange, a bit hazy, lasting white head. Sweet citrus (tangerine), light pine, light spice, long bitter finish. Delicious.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Clear, golden color . Medium -sized , white head with good lacing. Fantastic aroma of pine , citrus , apricot and a bunch of other fruits . Taste is malty and unbelievable juicy. Without alcohol notes at all. Probably, the best imperial lager i've ever tried.

12 oz pour from refrigerated bomber into stemmed tulip. Moderate head, nice lacing. Opaque, light orange, hazy. Lots of citrus up front. Nose is citrus and candy. Taste is citrus fruit. Fairly layered. I actually like this quite a bit, but somehow the aggregate ended up fairly low.
Apricot gold, small white head. Apricot, peach, citrus, flavor is caramel, citrus, peach, booze.

Bottle. Moderate malt aroma of roasted, heavy pine and grapefruit peel for the hops, light soap for the yeast, with notes of coriander and alcohol. Head is small, frothy, white with fair lacing and good legs, and is mostly diminishing. Color is slightly hazy medium amber. Flavor starts moderately sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes moderately sweet and heavily bitter. Palate is medium to full, syrupy with a soft to lively carbonation and a lightly to moderately alcoholic finish. A sweet and syrupy, slow drinking Strong Pale Lager.

Pours a slightly hazy gold color with a good lively head. Aroma is pine, resin, very floral bitter hops, fruits, orange, lemon, then caramel and toffee. Taste is caramel, toffee, butter richness, hoppy, floral, bitter, then sweeter fruit, like orange juice. Overall very impressive for a lager brewed by an ale centered brewery.

Cloudy hay colored. Light white head. Aroma of melon, light tobacco, citrus. A bit like a fruity cigarillo. Quite bitter, decently sweet, caramel. Medium body, quite oily. Alcohol is present, not overpowering. Acidic, fairly low amount of carbonation. Very good.

2/20 Bottle - Nice solid golden clean pour with a clean white head. Smelled of orange, lemon, and fruity hops. Tasted somewhat bitter, hoppy which I enjoyed it a lot. Higher carbonation than expected, it good drinking. The beer felt stronger/ more intense afterward than I expected based on the ABV, but clean taste and smooth going down. This is another very good offering by Founders, and I look forward to more pours of this and other offerings down the road
Resin, floral, herbs cleanly wrapped up in a hop forward complex lager. Whats not to like.

Clear light golden pour with an off-white head. Aroma is fruity hops. and malt. Taste is so crisp. Fruity hops, solid malt base. A pleasant drinking experience and another wonderful beer from Founders. Great lacing.
Really strong citrus aroma, taste is pretty blah, was hoping for more out of this one...

A clear golden orange 1 finger head but fades fast. Very english smelling nose. sweet nose as well. Very bitter, insanely bitter. almost sticks to my teeth . Hard to finish the glass. Nice mouthfeel. medium body hoppy finish. too intense for me.

Clear Golden pour with small off-white head. crystal malts. slight Spicy nose.
Medium body. Spicy slightly bitter boozy finish.

Very Nice.

The world needs more India Pale Lagers. Or maybe it just needs more beers like Dissenter. Maybe I just need more Dissenter. Enough of that. Dissenter pours golden orange. Theres not much head, but you dont need a lot of foam to take in the resinous hop aromas and bread-like malt. The taste could keep me happy all day long. Hops are citrusy and piney. The bread flavors help to smooth things over, but this Lager is undeniably hop-forward. Despite the bitterness, this brew is crisp and refreshing. Plenty of attitude but it tips back easily.

Bottle.

A- Bready, doughy, caramel, citrus, hoppy, piney, resinous.

A- Orange color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Bready, caramel. citrus, bitter, pine.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, bitter finish.

O- Boy this was a bitter one. At least a lot more than I expected it to be. Lots of caramel, bread, citrus, and pine. Almost reminded me of their Devil Dancer with age. Not bad at all but not particularly my thing.
This pours a pale golden transparent color. A fuzzy white head. Light hop bitterness nose. A small wheaty lager flavor. A nice mellow hop flavor. Not bad. Quite drinkable.

Nice aroma of citrus hops, with a hint of sweet breads in the background. Golden color with a lace white head. Sweet, bready malt up front. A little too sweet. Quickly followed by an alcohol burn, mixed with citrusy hops, and a strong bitterness. Blends together quite well on the finish. Slick mouthfeel but not off-putting. Somewhat peppery bitterness comes through as it warms up, but hard to find the "pilsner" flavor overall. Not bad though.

Pours a hazy, deep yellow color with a very nice, 1/4 inch dense white foamy head. Aroma has a very strong citrus nose at first with a pronounced orange nose, light lemon zest hints with some light pine in the finish. The malt of this beer sits behind the scenes and adds a light grainy presence late in the nose. Flavor starts off with a strong cascade hops orange note which is quickly followed up by light lager and grainy flavor at the end. Body is modest with a low amount of carbonation and a good deal of residual sweetness to hold the hoppy flavor and strong alcohol presence. Overall a good brew but nothing outstanding. I feel the high alcohol presence and large hops presence watered down the beer a bit.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a clear golden yellow with thick white head and tons of lacing. Big time hop aroma with citrus notes of lemon peel and some floral notes. Taste is unlike any other lager I've had. Absolutely no alcohol taste so this will really creep up on ya. Easily could pass as an Imperial IPA. Moderate to heavy bitterness with a nice malt backbone. Lot of citrus flavors with some grass and grainy flavors. Just an incredible beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle Poured a pale lager look with more gold colors and a nice bubbly white head. Completely unexpected aroma of fresh citrus hops. Sweet, hoppy flavor that almost reaches syrupy. Lingering bitter flavor with a hint of lager yeast. Really nice.

750 mL bottle from New Beer Distributors in New York, served in a stem glass. Pours clear straw-amber with a medium off-white head that fades to a thin cover and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has big noble hops, along with lager malts, apple, plum and soft herbs. The flavour is mildly malty sweet with pale malts, honey, slight fruit and a noble hop bitterness that increases over time. A touch of resin comes through as well. The finish is long and hoppy with a slight spice. On the palate, it is medium in body with a smooth, milky texture and average carbonation. Overall, a decent imperial pils. The hops could be a bit more prominent up front. 2014-12-06

Bottle. Pours out a deeper golden color with a small white head. Aroma is of some nice fruity/citrusy hops, bready malts, light sweet/sticky cereal notes. Taste is complex, light fruity hops, some pine, fruitiness, mild alcohol notes, sticky sweet cereal grains, and a nice hop finish. Solid.

30 Dec 2014, bottle. yellow, clear, steady bubbles. nose is lemon citrus. thin/med body and moderately fizzy. pine and grapefruit hops, moderate alcohol, granola malt and slightly sweet. pretty good for an imperial lager.

This was probably a bit old as it smelled like a musty orange. Cloudy orange color. Very assertive bitterness which lingers into the finish. The orange flavor lasts. Not a bad beer though I wish I had a fresher example. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Local Wine Dog bottle. Classic pale lager look with gold colors and a nice bubbly white head. Completely unexpected aroma of fresh citrus hops. Sweet, hoppy flavor that almost reaches syrupy. Lingering bitter flavor with a hint of lager yeast. Really nice.
Bottle sample at the Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks DSG. Pours yellow with a small head, aroma of marmalade, caramel, orange, flavor of marmalade, caramel, bitter, medium bodied.
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Hoppy grapefruit with passionfruit and mango, very tropical with a nice bitter kick to it. Greatly balanced and nice mouthfeel, probably the best lager beer Ive had.
I like it but sure is pricey for what it is. Very hoppy .....................,....
Bottle pours a cloudy lemon yellow with small head and lacing. Aromas of citrus, earthy, clove and bread. Flavor is quite bitter.
Well a really nice IPL, hardly distinguishable from an IPA. Golden color, modest head, plenty of fragrance and a subtle moppy off note.

Pour is a hazy yellow with a large white head. Aroma is a eye opening citrusy hop. Just as good as any IPA. Flavor is again more of a melon rind hop with some cakey sweet malt. In a blind tasting one would probably consider this a IPA more often then not, its that hoppy. Gotta keep reminding myself this is no chugging lager as there is no noticeable alcohol. Solid beer for those looking for more out of a lager.
Has the distinctive founders style of hoppiness. Citrusy, earthy, and a bit spicy. Has an interesting sharp clean finish unlike other beers of theirs.

Bomber pours a clear golden yellow with small white head and a little lacing. Aroma is mostly citrus hops, with some cloves and biscuits. Taste is bitter with some malty sweetness in the middle before a bitter, grassy and almost dank finish kicks in. Body is medium with slight carbonation and a sticky mouthfeel. Im surprised this is a lager. Its a decent IIPA in my book. although a littlet pricey.

Quite hoppy aroma. Citrus hops. A little spice, perhaps a slight touch of clove. Hint if hefeweizen.

Color is a cloudy yellow-orange. Small light cream colored head.

Taste: mostly a moderate amount of hop bitterness.

Medium body, moderate carbonation. Finish is long with the hop bitterness combining with the carbonation is quite nice.

Overall I liked this more than I was expecting. For a lager its pretty complex. Really reminds me more of a pretty good IPA.
Pours hazy golden orange with white head. Smell is hops, tropical fruit and caramel malts. Taste is hops, pine, citrus and a crisp malt finish. Medium body, medium carb.

A good night is one in which I get to try 2 new releases from Founders. The mysterious label seems to have a story behind it. Dark gold pour with a crackling head. The humid aroma carries hints of cheese and lemons. Dissenters flavor is very interesting and hard to pin down. There is a little Belgian golden or tripel taste, plus strong lager and pale ale notes. There is a fair amount of honey taste, and the hops are robust but not too intense. Another rock solid release from Founders.
75cl, Vintage 2014, new exclusive American brew, thx alot to Hans for sharing!, complex bitter brew, malty/fruity/bitter and slightly woody/floral, balanced, hazy, good head, good brew

Shared 25.4 oz. bottle, poured to snifters showing a hazed, orangey gold color, with a modest layer of bubbly, soft white head foam, and some dots & dashes of lacing. The nose was extremely dank & citrusy, with some grassiness & greenery. The taste started with a touch of malt sweetness, then exposed a quite lingering, earthy & rind-like bitterness. Medium+ bodied, with decent carbonation, nice alcohol warmth, and agreeably crisp & clean finish. Any tropical notes seemed to escape me.

Bomber from New Pi. Very fresh hop aroma. Pale yellow pour, dense white head. Smooth body, lots of tropical fruit hop flavors. Dry finish. Its very good--Im not sure its worth the price, but tasty.

Bottle... Pours clear and amber with a wispy, white head. The olfactory highlights include citrus rinds, pine resin and tea biscuits. Full-bodied with a fatty mouthfeel and adequate carbonation. The flavor provides tons of rindy, tannic bitterness. Lengthy, bitter, grassy finish. Bottle shared by growler!

Poured from bomber into tulip glass. Very nice hoppy aromas and flavor. Lots of grapefruit and some pine. Really, this drinks like an IPA, with only the lack of body and clean finish really announcing itself as a lager.

At a tasting, thanks DSG, smallish bubby head, a touch hazy very light orange color, aroma of orange marmalade, wood and some pine in the back, flavor of orange marmalade and some honey and tea, a bit too sweet, medium to strong bitterness, feels unbalanced. Nice but a little too old.
Bottle pours clear light orange with fluffy head. Aroma of soapy hop and malt. taste is crisp and sweet grassy hop.

Hazy golden, amber body with a thin white head. Aroma is slightly hoppy with a bit of grapefruit with notes of bread. Flavor is citrus hops, primarily grapefruit. Surprisingly big malt body with a smooth finish. Finishes light and clean.

Wife: 3.5

Pours a slightly murky golden with a white head which laces.......aroma is pine, citrus, mango.....taste is everything up front, never seems to travel on the palette, different......pine, citrus fruits, melon, slight bitterness and smooth mouthfeel. Nicely done.

Draught @ BAJT. Pours tiny hazy pale golden with a rather small frothy and bubbly offwhite head that slowly dissipates while leaving some spotty trace on the glass. Smell is tiny malty and fruity with white bread, toffee, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, moist grass, pine needles, orange zest, lemon zest and hints of alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet, bitter, tiny malty and fruity with white bread, toffee, grapefruit juice, pineapple, mango, star fruit, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals, orange zest, lemon zest and hints of resin and butterscotch. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny astringent, tiny boozy and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, bitter and fruity with white bread, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, star fruit, resin, alcohol, orange zest and lemon zest. Top notch IIPL! Nicely balanced between the sweetness, bitterness, hops and alcohol.

Draught at SBWF 2014. Clear golden liquid with a small to medium white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, grapefruit, bread and mango. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of mango, citrus, pine and bread. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.

Capped 750 from Wine & Cheese. Pours translucent gold with a slight white head. Aroma seems grassy/pine. Med + body. Flavor is very hoppy, seems citrus/pine/noble, and the malt seems pils. Very tasty brew, showing little heat and finishing hoppy and bitter. Very nice indeed.
Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours dirty blonde with a modest off-white head and a pleasant citrus sroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a tasty hop profile. Nicely done.
Bottle. Golden yellow pour, thin white head. Some tropical fruit and citrus aromas. Nicely balanced sweet and hoppy flavour with citrus, tropical fruit and some grassy notes. Pretty tasty.
Nice balance, smooth, sweet taste, nice lush mouthfeel. Nose is citrus IPA like. Taste a bit floral along with the sweet. No off taste despite the lightness. Very nice.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. 2014 bottle. Hazy gold with a white head. Aroma of grains, slightly honey-ish malt and somewhat stlae hops, slightly citric. Sweetish malty flavor, slightly honey-ish, with bitterish hops, somewhat stale. Medium-bodied. OK, doesnt seem fresh.
Pale male, lager yeast, floral aroma. Clear golden yellow orange with foamy white head. Crisp, malty, clean lager, hoppy, mild bitterness, floral flavor.
On tap, this was a surprise, more like a pale ale rather than lager, but that might be due to the high ABV, a very drinkable beer, beautifully balanced

Pours clear golden with large white head out of bottle. Amazing aroma of hops, grapefruit, and sweet tropical fruits. Flavor very much like aroma. Dang good beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear light amber, bubbly off-white rim head, strings of lace. Taste is a pleasant blend of sweet malt and citrus hops. Both sides are assertive and each takes its turn waffling in and out right through a long finish. Solid stuff.

Look: pours a golden color. Very clear and bright white head. Just like lager should.
Smell: huge hop aroma. Grape fruit. Pineapple. Passion fruit. Very little if any malt. 
Taste: huge hop taste. Bitter on the front. Bitter on the back but very smooth as well. 
Feel: does feel like a lager. More like an IPA. Medium carbonation. Leaves a thick layer on the mouth.
Overall: good beer. Not what I expected based on other IPLs. Like this one much more. Like the hop taste and stone.
First drank: home 11/5/14

October 4, 2014. On tap at SBWF. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma is grapefruit, resin, grass, pear and light biscuit. Taste is light sweet fruity, medium bitter with a grassy and citrusy finish. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.

Aroma is fruity and wooden along with some sweet alcohol and nice maltiness to it. Flavour is very similar, but with a slight tart and also alcoholic sweet kick to it. Mild gluelike sweetness in the finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a creamy to frothy head that leaves good lacing. Lightly bitter lightly sweet, nice malt backbone, hides alcohol well, too many bubbles (lively carbonation) and a light bitter finish. Nice.

Bottle @ home. Thanks, Richard. Clear bright golden pour with white foam. Intense resinous pine aroma. A lot of citrus oils and grapefruit, too. Some sweet pineapple and mango give it a slight tropical quality. Mild malt sweetness, too. Flavor is quite bitter and aggressive. Tons of pine, herbs, and citrus rind. A nice fragrant grapefruit and orange citrus character. Hints of honey and simple syrup.

Bottle. Pine, grapefruit peel, and light caramel malt aroma. Golden yellow with nice head. Sweet orange caramel malt and moderately strong bitter pine/grapefruit peel flavor. Great balance. Excellent - the best IPL Ive had to date.
Big citrus hops, light malt, some biscuits. Flavor is oranges, some sulphur, a bit syrupy sweet and boozy too. Not all that lager like, really. Ok, but not that impressive.

Pours mostly opaque deep orange with a small grayish white head. Aroma and flavor have subtle piney and lemony zest hops with the pilsner/lager yeast base giving it the unique difference in flavor from an IPA or even pale ale. Subtle bitterness on the end, and not too carbonated. Goes down smooth and perfect with Palermos pizza.

Bottle thanks to Jeff. Pours a golden orange/yellow with soapy white head. Aroma is resinous hops, some grass and slightly dank. Taste is refreshing for an 8%+ beer. Grass in the initial taste, some dry tastes of hop and earth. Clean and nice.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottle - 750mL crowned. Golden amber pour with a short white head. Bready malts, light caramel, floral hops and citrus in the nose. Taste is floral hops, citrus fruit, hop resins, toasted malt, light caramel and bread. Body is medium to medium-full with a moderate, bubbly carbonation. Ends with more floral hops, citrus fruit, hop oils, tropical fruit, toasted malt, bread and light caramel.
Outstanding flavor and not a trace of alcohol. Not your typical lager at all -- more of an imperial IPA. Found it on sale in Montpelier VTs Hunger Mountain Coop.

Pours a clear golden with a thick and frothy eggshell head. Crisp, malty aroma has a strong overtone of apple and some pear, plus more than a hint of hops. Flavor is more ale-ish than lager-ish, malty and fruity with a hoppy underpinning. Firm texture has some good fizz. Go ahead, be a dissenter! Mavericks are the ones who move society forward.

750 ml. capped bottle. Pours a medium, poorly retained off white head with extensive lacing, over a clear, gold (SRM 5) body.....nose is light toasted malts, pine, grapefruit peel, light floral notes from the hops, balance to the hops.....taste starts with hints of pear, apple, type sweetness, becoming pine, resin, citrus peel, heavy licorice, finishing with a moderate, lingering bitterness, balance to the hops.....mouth feel, medium body, slight hop numbness, moderate alcohol warmth, light acid, medium carbonation. This is an interesting new style. The malt back bone is very dominated in both aroma and flavor by the hops. The result is a beer that show cases the brewers skill in hop selection and management against lighter and simpler malts. The brewers at Founders are quite adept and have made a delicious and dangerous beer. BJCP 8/3/16/4/7

750ml bottle from local liquor store orlando. Pours clearish pale yellow with white foam head. Not quite clear but looks like a lager. Nose is tropical fruit, mango, citrus pine. Really nice hop nose. Flavour is sweet biscuit with mango, peach, resinous hops then a medium bitter hit. Has the lightness of a lager and that creamy mouthfeel. Very clean crisp finish. If only this was pouring out of all the regular Lager taps. Fantastic.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Nose is hugely fruity, with loads of oranges, citrus and piney hops, and grass. Flavour is like a IIPA, with loads of resinous hops, pine, and huge fruity notes. Huge flavours from the resinous and fruity hops. Phenomenal stuff.
Draft @ SBWF 2014. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty piney hoppy aroma. Fruity malty piney hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty piney hoppy finish.

Gold pour with watery white head. Very citrus forward aroma with light malt kicker. Semi sweet malt start with citrus/lite resiny hops flavor. Good bitter finish to a medium bodied beer. Slightly sweet finish as well. Good carbonation. solid/clean/nice

Pours clear golden orange with a small white head. Smell is strongly of citrus and piny hops. Taste is strongly hoppy, lots of citrus. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Founders Dissenter IPL finishes with a lingering lager dryness.

Pours a clear gold with soapy white head that calms to a film and soft foamy bubbles and some lacing. Aroma is sweet hoppy resinous fruit esters and corn, grass. Taste is sweet and bitter with pine/spruce subtle citrus and grainy corn pine needles. Palate is full slick noticeable alcohol and bears a drying finish. Very enjoyable, want more and is a kick in the pants for being so drinkable! Aug.19th 2014

Picked up this bottle at the brewery and enjoyed in my hotel room last night. Pours golden amber, foamy head that was slightly off white, frothy. Nose was full of pine and some dank. Taste was a punch of hops and bitterness followed by a light slap of pale malt. Medium body with ample carbonation. Pretty decent brew.

Bottle. Crystal clear, golden body. Frothy white head, rapidly diminishing. Strong hop aroma. Grapefruit, orange juice, citrus. Notes of toasted grain. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finishes moderately sweet and moderately bitter, with a lingering bitterness. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation. Lightly alcoholic finish. I shouldnt have liked this beer as much as I did. Its overly sweet and overly boozy. But still enjoyable.

Gold pour with decent head. Aroma is bursting with fruity hops, some grass and light butterscotch. Taste is nice grassy bitterness with honey and lemon. There is a substansive alcohol presence as you would expect from an IPL but the flavors goes along well enough with it. A rare hit by Founders, especially considering how hard it is to master the outcast of a style that is IPL.

750 ml bottle

A release that sparkles with a combination of hops and malt, this release caught my eye as I was checking out. I am not entirely sure what to make of this new trend of IPLs but if many of them maintain this level of quality I look forward to more breweries giving this a shot.

Aroma / Appearance - A caramelly transparent core bubbles with carbonation. A crisp white head traps the smell of fresh orange floor wax, wet paper pulp, and malty citrus. A bright texture settles over the course of a few minutes.

Flavor / Palate - Carbonated malts tickle the tongue before the first wave of hops scrub the palate clean. Orange glaze and resiny hops warm the throat. A long finish adds layers of rye and peppery spices. More malty than expected, this carves out a new niche that makes it a potential trendsetter for years to come.

Botte shared by Drock, thanks bud! Yellow lager cat pea pour with a nice finger of white head. Hoppy aroma, tropical fruits, citrus, quite nice. Taste is malty sweetness up front, light grassy hops, with a bit of citrus in the finish. Pretty darn tasty for a lager.

From a tap this has a big contemporary BO aroma, just like many newer IPA. Clear pale yellow. WEW, from the start this is flat, bitter and on style for an IPA. Why are we tring to turn lagers into IPA, go freaken figger. Mouth coating IPA BS. Overall, what else can be said. Rude and nasty. Borders on imperial IPA territory. Not impressed. Leave my lagers alone, will ya?
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Serving: Draft at Fire Works Leesburg. Solid gold pour with a slight haze and a lasting white head. Loads of sticky, resinous, herbal hops in the nose. The flavor delivers on the the promising aromas. Dank, resin, herbal, and tropical fruit notes on the palate. Dangerously drinkable with a long, hoppy finish. Great brew.

Aroma is citrusy and hoppy. Grapefruit and orange. Taste is grapefruit, orange, corriander and hops. Malty back end with some hop bitterness. Lagering comes through on back end. Very good imperial IPL. High abv is well hidden. Very good.

Pours a golden color with a white head leaving moderate lacing. Strong hops aroma with notes of apple and pine. Strong hoppy flavor up front with pine, coriander and some other toned down spices. Leaves a nice hoppy aftertaste.

Draught samle at SBWF.
Fresh hoppy aroma.
Balanced brew, hint of bitterness and lots of grapefruit. One of the best modern hop lagers I have had.

Appearance: pours with a smaller beige head that dissipates quickly, the beer is a slightly hazy lighter gold or orange color Aroma: strong citrus, perhaps some egg, not very complex but smells good Taste: bitterness, orange citrus, pine, lots of grass, not much from the malt at all Palate: light mouthfeel, strong bitter aftertaste, lively carbonation Overall: an amazing lager, Ive never had a lager of this quality before, delicious, not much in the way of malt but that doesnt matter, lots of flavor and bitterness from the hops on a very light foundation, alcohol is very much hidden ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at SBWF2014. Clear golden color, small white head. Sticky gooseberry aroma. Light-bodied. Flavor has kots of gooseberries and fruity sweetness. Nice hoppy lager.

Pint on tap. Clear golden beer, quite hoppy, on the bitter side. Very strong taste for a lager, I think its too much actually, but Im picky. Real real bitter, this is why I prefer ales. Still good, though.
Sample @ SBWF. Had no idea that this was a imperial pils rather than an IPA. Anyway, its sweet and fruity with notes of red oranges and citrus candy.

22 oz. bottle from Lighthouse. It pours a light golden color with a white head. The aroma is peachy with some pine, toffee and florals. The flavor is the same. A little tropical fruit, strong peaches, toffee and a dry, piney finish. Very IIPA-like. Tasty, but I would have liked a simpler, drier malt profile in this Imperial Pils.
On tap @ Beer Camp - Chicago. Pour is hazy yellow/orange with a small white head. Aroma and flavor of floral hops, citrus peel, pine resin, and slight grass.

Tap at Eastside. Clear gold pour with a nice white head. Aroma is citrus rind, sweet tropical fruit, and cereal. Taste follows the aroma with a good deal of bitterness and a clean finish. Medium light body.

Bottle: Deep golden near coppery hue with a rocky head and very good lace. Honestly this isnt much removed from a west coast DIPA with juicyness and resiny hop profile and a very dry and mostly clean finish. A tad metallic and minerally however. Unassuming pale malt structure. A tad medicinal as it warmed. Nice but nothing I would buy again.

A $12 750 purchased at Wegmans. Let me just get to the money shot here. Its a mess. Yes its a lager, yes it has hops. But thats it. Ive had a couple IPLs that were really good. This aint one of them. Theres too much IPA (isylproplyalcohol) here. And it combines with the bitter hops. Kind of a nondescript bitter burning mess. Big, light lagers are tough to brew well and Founders missed the boat on this one. If this didnt have the Founders label on it, it would have crap ratings. Avoid, especially for this price.

From a 750ml brown bottle. Gold and quite clear. Thin ring of white foam in the glass. Hoppy nose, orange peel and pine. Taste has big hops - citrus and pine again, malts are crisp and dryish. Way better than I was expecting.

Bottle to tulip
Lots of C hops, spruce, grapefruit. Clear light amber with no head. Spruce and hops. Whew.
Bottle - Lemon rind and pale malts. Clear gold with a decent white head. Sweet citrus, pale malts and an oily hoppy finish. Nice and tasty.

Sweet, perfume of peach and pomelo. Hazy straw color, lively carbonation. Flavor is citrus, clean, crisp and mellowing into pine resin. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden-amber with a bubbly white head. Big citrus hops aroma, lots of orange and tangerine, with spiky yeast notes, malt, and sugar. Bitter taste, preserved citrus, malt, orange zest, a hint of pine, and some sugary baked goods. Lingering bitter citrus. Very tasty.

750ml bottle in a teku. Pours amber with a lacy, cream-colored head. Aroma of floral and lightly citrusy hops, some pale and caramel malts, and some dough. Flavor the same with a nice hoppiness. Average texture. A pretty good beer, but could be hoppier and more balanced.

Pours clear golden with low white head. Aroma of mango, caramel, citrus, light bread. Taste is bitter up front, slight sweetness, then a long bitter finish. Body is light to medium, smooth, with soft carbonation.

Pours clear amber with low white head
Aromas lovely of pineapple, citrus, mango, pine, resin
Taste has very nice round big caramel body loaded with pineapple and citrusy fruits. Bit sticky ending but overall very good!

An IPL? Astounding. Pours a semi clear light amber with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of grapefruit, pine cones, grass, peach, Apricot and some herbal notes. Taste is grapefruit, pine cones, grass, Apricot, peach, citrus and herbs. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Mind-bogglingly good!

Clean mild orange. Floral aroma lacquered in washy alcoholic sweetness. White sugar and corn-like sweetness; metallic earthiness, wet and grassy. Dank and sweaty. The flavor is overwhelming in tropical hop flavor; citrus oils, marmalade, and tangerine are enough to mask the rough alcohol and grainy malt typical of the style. Ultimately, the combination results in an overweight orange candy flavor, and wisps of fusel vapor are fluttering in and out constantly. Still, the palate is reined in, and the finish is surprisingly soft with a white tea-like bittersweetness that draws out.
Nice clean finish, hoppy but not hoppy overload. Golden hazy color and a fruity aroma. Very drinkable especially for an 8.7. Bomber yo
Un liquide aussi croustillant que collant où habite une résine franche. Des notes tropicales et coniféreuses nous amènent vers une amertume raisonnable. Buvabilité certaine.

Bottle-Pours bright orange hue with a small fizzy white head that didnt last long just around the rim of the glass. little to no lacing. Nose is bright tropical squeezed citrus-lots of lemon, tangerine and some peppery notes. Flavors follow suit huge blast of citric hops with very little malt at all. there is no tale that this is actually a Lager in the flavors. If you gave this to me blindly, i would think its just another good IPA. Palate is where this beer suffers however, i bet some would think it excels. Its thin and slightly watery with no real substance. The hop flavors are very big however, the alcohol heat comes in big on the long finish. the more this beer warms, the more the flaws come out. Very bitter hops here, sandpapery on the tongue. A good brew but i couldnt do it again.

My Bottom Line:
Tropical fruit plunge into potent resins in this relatively lean and drinkable strong lager.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the pale blond.
-Alcohol is camouflaged by the finishing resinous bitterness.
-The body is leaner than expected, which I appreciate.
-Cereals offer a few crunchy moments; there is no sloppiness here.

Bottle; gros merci Martin et Michèle!

Appearance: deep honey gold, short creamy white head, minimal lacing. Aroma: huge nose of citrus, pine, marmalade, and honey grahams.  Taste: as the aroma indicates.  Finish: lingering bitterness vies for primacy against a syrupy sweet caramel malt backbone. Notes: Wow. Biggest lager Ive ever had. Wouldnt say I actually liked it all that much, but I sure am glad I tried it.
Bottle pour. Pours a clear gold with a white head of foam. The aroma is pine, resin, and grapefruit. The taste is mildly bitter and resinous. Light body. Medium carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2014 A conversation starter of a beer. Brings out some deep hop notes amidst a clean palate and crispy smooth mouthfeel. Light floral feel on the nose. Bold and layered. There is an IPA feel but this is rooted firmly in the lager camp, which sort of makes it an odd and unique hybrid. A diversion from the usual Backstage series offerings but worthy of a look nonetheless.

Bottle courtesy of bytemesis. Hazy golden orange color, not much foam. Light grainy aroma with passion fruit, mango hop notes. Flavor brings more of the hop bitterness, resin, nothing screams lager. Solid drinkable beer but the lager aspect doesnt bring much to the table. Could just as well drink one of the many excellent IPAs that are out there.
Nothing bizarre or outcropping about this one except for its remarkable drinkability. Clean, tasty, nicely hopped. Incredible balance. On tap, Baby Proof.

Bomber to lager glass. Pours a hazy light - medium yellow with a nice white head that holds on good. Great aroma is of floral and citrus hops, but has a wet hop nose to it. Awesome flavors of hops and perfect malt balance, crisp lager finish. Beautiful.
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo. Great beer, huge flavorful bitterness. easy drinking, great mouthfeel. seek out
(bottle - 750 ml) Clear copper with a soapy head. Citrus and pine resin in the nose. Spicy hops at the start with a bit of pepper and citrus and a very dry resin finish. A bit bitter.

The Dissenter pours a a slightly orange yellow with thick ivory head that lasts a decent while. The aroma is citrus, biscuit, orange and mango. The flavor is orange, mango and biscuit. Overall this is a very nice beer. It drinks smoothly hiding the high ABV and is packed with flavor.
Bright orange clear pour with white head. Tropical grapefruit and peach aroma. Orange and vanilla notes. Full body. Good beer

750 ml bottle from Premier Gourmet. Pours a clear golden colour with creamy white head that sticks around. Aroma is pine resin, tropical fruit, grass, as well as a little bready, caramelly malt. Flavour is big on resiny and citrusy hops, some grassy notes, sweetish caramel and some breadiness. Carbonation on the livelier side. Nice bitterness in finish. Impressive.

Refreshing aromas of tropical fruit leap to the forefront companied by subtle notes of citrus. A quickly disapearing white head sits atop a clear amber pour which produces little lacing. Malts are present but they take a distinct backseat to the assertively hoppy palate. Medium body and medium carbonation. Overall, while refreshing and the hint of tropical fruit was present in the taste, this beer could have used more malt flavors to balance the bitterness of the hops.
Pours gold and clear. Aroma of pine and citrus. Flavor is resiny pine, with pretty strong bitterness for a lager. Crisp and light-bodied. A little alcohol burn in there. Good.

draft that poured a medium yellow with white head. nice medium to heavy malt aroma with plenty of pine notes. the flavor is like a strong pils. malt forward and strong with plenty of pine hops mingled throughout. crisp clean finish. another excellent brew from founders.

Slightly hazy golden amber pour with a thick white head. Bready and hoppy nose. Really nice taste - surprisingly easy to drink for nearly 9%. Nice apricot hop flavor and a tropical bitterness in the finish. Might be the nicest of the series in a while, yet sitting on shelves around here because its not barrel aged? Double You Tee Eff?

Interesting beer. The bitter, pine flavor of the hops is really emphasized in this one. Little of the fruity, citrus, tropical fruit flavors that one associates with IPAs. Pours a copper gold with small head. Not sure I liked it as much as a good IPA.

Very intense resinous and grassy hops with little of the citrus character Id like in a beer of this style. High bitterness. Malt confers almost zero flavor, which is not really my thing for lager styles. Tricky beer to rate, well made but not in my wheelhouse.
Bottle. Pours crystal clear golden with nice white head and some lacing. Nose is all tropical fruits and pineapple. Taste adds some mango with some nice clean bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel. Great IPL.

Crystal clear with a thin white head. Sweet floral nose. Smooth sweet bit plummy. Light bitter finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft a mellow mushroom. Pours a light orange. Smell is nothing. Mild hops. Taste is the same. Some bitterness with what tastes like old hops. Tastes like it is flat. Being on draft maybe its a little old. I would be interested to try it in a bottle to compare. Not impressed. Wouldnt order it again.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Clear golden orange with a small white head. Nice citrus zest and resinous hop aroma with some floral notes as well. Clean malt sweetness with some mild hop flavor and assertive bitterness. Full body with subdued alcohol. Pretty good.
From flandersned-thanks, Steve! Deep gold. Nose of tropical fruit hops. Well balanced but hop driven lightly bitter. Drinks like a good DIPA. Alcohol well hidden.
Absolutely love this brewery but this is one that is average at best. Fairly crisp, bright, spicy, tropic fruit, fresh cut grass, and pepper. Solid but nothing exciting.

750 ml bottle shared by Phatdog1, much thanks Craig! Clear gold with massive head retention. Aroma shows a decent amount of grassy and floral hop character. 
Well the flavor does show an array of hop flavors, and really Insane for a lager yeast brew. The floral and earthy hops really overtake any other flavor that I could possibly come up with. A very oxymoron style if you ask me. Imperial pale lager? I can actually taste the alcohol after the blast of floral and grassy hops. If you want to brew a big IPA, then BREW a bigger IPA, what is the point here? Looks like a big marketing scheme. 
Anyway.... I would have scored this higher based on the flavor with the exception of the harsh slap of booze in the finish. I simply cant kiss Founders rear end on this style. I have to be honest.

Confucius says, "He who speaks without modesty will find it difficult to make his words good." Superspak says, "750 ml bottle into lager glass; no bottle dating, but was just released. Pours crystal clear pale golden color with a 1 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass. Aromas of big tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, lemon zest, apricot, floral, grass, pine, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity of bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate pale malt balance; with great strength. Taste of big tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, lemon zest, apricot, floral, grass, pine, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Good amount of earthy pine/grassy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, lemon zest, apricot, pine, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity of bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate pale malt sweetness; with a nice malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and moderately sticky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent IPL. All around great complexity and balance of citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate pale malt sweetness; and very smooth and crisp to drink for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering."
Bomber thanks to the the shot in the back AndyReynolds - nose is inviting: citrus and light pine with distant cat urine. Quite hoppy and sticky. Good, its good.

Golden beer out of the bottle with a foamy white head that left literal sheets of foam on the side of the glass. Light nose of grain and alcohol. Thick caramel sweetness with some coarse bready malts and some crackers but then the alcohol and bright orange and red grapefruit quickly dominate. Quite nice for a gimmick style.

Clear golden pour thin white head and light sticky lacing ... Aroma of lemon and citrusy hops .... Taste is of resiny rindy hops, citrusy and lemony hop flavors, definitely has a floral hop as well with a bitter rindy bite ... This is a lager? ... Has a dry bitter bite with a clean finish and some lingering bitter citrusy hop bite ... Solid and the abv is hidden very well
Very dark yellow pour with good head. Malty nose.. a bit of hop bitter finish but well balanced.doesnt drink like a heavy beer.

Clear golden pour with a thin head. Aroma of dish soap. Citrus, probably Cascade hops. Medium mouth. Bursting with floral hops. Tons of flavor. Lace present. Really fresh. Nice back end bouquet of floral notes. Alcohol is well hidden. Having a hard time believing this is a lager, but it is. Real tasty.

Poured from bomber into snifter at 2am in front of a billowing chiminea stuffed with piñon from New Mexico. Easily best in its class. Looks, smells, tastes like an IPA/pale, but has the body of a lager. Well done Founders, well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of hops, taste is hoppy, mild bitterness, some citrus, mild alcohol. I really this this beer, great for the style.

Bottle at Corkscrews with Aaron. Pour is clear golden with a big white head and great lacing. Grassy, some pineapple, orange oeel, biscuit, straw, and lemony aroma. Taste is grassy, light lemon, orange peel, some straw, grapefruits, and husky with a lightly bitter finish. Medium mouthfeel with high carbonation. Solid.

Bottle with Stephen. Thanks Max Boost! Pours a clear golden yellow appearance with a white head. Pretty juicy, lemon, light tropical fruity, herbal aroma. Pretty big and malty. Dried out pretty well. Lots of tropical fruit and mango. Pretty delicious and I love the boost. Probably should have drank this a bit fresher. Drank next to King Sue and just as good.
750, this is great, light, on its feet, hoppy, some alcohol that adds to the body, fantastic stuff.
750ml bottle of 2014 vintage thanks to Rob. Pours a golden color with a bit of head. Lots of citrusy hoppiness but without overpowering the malt. A bit of alcohol harshness.

Bottle; pour is fairly clear, medium golden, with a frothy off white head into this glass. It retains fairly well, with sticky lacing presence here. Its hop dominant on the nose; tropical notes, melon, with sticky caramel and breast malts; honestly its a bit much. The flavor profile is somewhat more refined, with a softer hop presence initial; florals, more citrus presence, moving to more of the breast malts, feint earthiness, and a robust mouthfeel overall. Its not bad but...

Nearly clear gold pour with a 1-2 finger, creamy off white head capped by some lighter, soapier bubbles. Aroma is huge on tropical fruit and bright citrus notes, a little biscuit, some nice stone fruit and a little cat boxy pine. Flavor is cereal and biscuit up front, then loads of passion fruit heavy tropical fruit, sweet and bitter stone fruit, fruity floral notes and a full and complex range of citrus notes building to the finish where a little Simcoe-like cat box pine creeps in as well. Medium body, dry, but juicy, hop acid filled entry, leading to a chewy and juicy middle, medium, somewhat sharp carbonation and dry, biting, white grapefruit juice-like finish. Fantastic stuff, great hop blend, just enough malt presence to shine through here and there, but not get in the way. Awesome, though Im going to venture to guess the shelf life on its awesomeness is short.

Poured from a bomber into a Founders pint glass clear yellow gold with a off white head.
Aroma is bready hops.
Flavor is grassy sweet crackers. Ton of hops for a lager but then this is more IPA than lager to me. Smooth lager start with a huge bitter finish. Had this brew at a tasting and immediately sought out to snag a bottle for myself which I am drinking now. Lovely!
Gold color with a medium head. Light mango and tropical fruit aroma. Sweet, juicy fruit flavor. Very tropical. Some caramelized sugar. Full bodied.
Delicious. Fruity full hop aroma well coated palate a bit of Graham cracker sweetness. Enjoyed this one
Thanks to Mike for the bottle. Clear gold pour with a thick white head. Tropical fruit hops, resiny aroma. Clean crisp malt with clean resiny hop bitterness. Tasty brew.

750 ml bottle at home during the Bengals game. Pours a clear golden color with a medium sized off white head that leaves some lacing. The aroma and flavor have a crazy amount of hops for a lager; citrus, resiny, dank, very much like a West Coast IPA, some toasted malts, grassy, some mild alcohol heat, very drinkable.
Tremendous really good drinkable representative of an IPL. Good hop aromas. Smooth mouthfeel.

750 ml bottle courtesy of Sammy. Thanks. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a small white head that has fair retention. The aroma is big and bold with tropical fruits, jucyfruit gum and a trace of caramel. The taste features more tropical fruits, banana, persimmon, and all set nicely in a pils malt base. The palate is full and the carbonation is soft. Finishes short and dry. Overall: Real nice fruit cocktail here.
Pours clear pale orange with a white head. Aroma is strong tropical fruit with a hint of pine and caramel. Taste follows nose

Keg @ Sedona. Gold with a small head. White grape and honey. Lemon. White bread. Similar flavor. Lemon jellies, mars allow. Tea. Loads of lemon. Quite fizzy. Candy straw and bread. Very bitter. Medium body, soft carb.

Pours a clear golden with a defined foamy off white head. The aroma has a very foral tropical citrus hop scent with grassy and light malt notes. There is a soft spicy and booze like scents too. As I taste this beverage I noticed there was a medium level of bitterness, very thin body, balanced flavor of grains to sweetness, and a nice soft booze character that blended well. The finish has an enjoyable bitterness, semi sweet pilsner dominated malt taste, with a mild booze dryness. Overall I liked the thin smooth body that makes this brew very drinkable while being a flavorful drink. This seems to be a gimmick type style but in all honesty this is a style has been done before and may or should gain popularity.
Shared bomber. Crisp-looking pale gold color. Citrus nose. Bitter palate, yet smooth. ABV camouflaged by flavorful finish.

pours a slight cloudy golden color with a thin white head.big citrus and tropical fruit aromas but not a resinous as i thought i would have been. flavor is citrus and tropical fruits and once again, not as resinous as an ipa would be. thin to medium body, medium carbonation. slick mouth feel and a slightly bitter finish.at 8.7 this is could get you in trouble because it is so tasty and drinkable. sipping quite fast on this one.

Location: Bomber from Melville Superstar Beverage, 9/4/14, 


Aroma: The nose is big and hoppy, plenty of citrus hops, some grass, light malts, and a little hay

Appearance: It pours a clear, bright golden color with a small white head and medium lace

Flavor: The flavor is quite bitter, even moreso than expected, with a very mild sweetness

Palate: It has a solid mouthfeel, an average-plus carbonation, and a lengthy, dry finish

Overall Impression: 
Welcome back into my life (and my beer ratings) to the NFL season.  Happy Kick-off to the 2014 Season Day!  This is a quite bitter example of an IPL, but the bitterness works rather well. I was very impressed by this one. It has a great aroma and a flavor that almost matches. Id call their foray back into lagers a success.

I never thought I would rate a pale lager this high... But when youre talking founders backstage series and India pale lager. You have to think they know what theyre doing. Aromas are beautiful citrus and tropical fruit with some dank spiciness. Flavors are so smooth. Hoppy and malty in harmony. Long lasting finish. Excellent!

Bottle. Pours crystal clear butterscotch, small white head, dissipates quickly, some lacing. Aroma is passionfruit, mango, spruce, dank leaves. Flavor is very lightly sweet, medium bitter, not harsh, dank and tropical. Medium body, lingering bitter finish. Nice effort.

750 ml bottle from Homer321- thanks again, Sean! Pours a clear gold with a small white head that leaves a few spots of lace. There are some small rising carbonation bubbles, too. Aroma of cereal, crackers, straw, booze, grass, and fainter citrus and floral notes. The flavor mostly follows the same lines, but theres a more pronounced citrus peel and floral bitterness. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet, bitter mouthfeel. Not a bad beer, but not my thing.

Bomber:
Clear, deep gold with a tall, off-white head.
Nice, bold, fresh grapefruit aroma.
Taste is intense, pine/resin/grapefruit-peel.
Citrus, lemon, big bittering...
Creamy, yet biting....tingly, white peppered.
Verges on stickiness....a hair away from DIPA-texturing.
IPA-driven, but still there are some Pils notes.
Exceptionally well done.....really like this one.

It poured a golden color with a white head. The aroma was of pine, citrus and some tropical fruits. The taste was bitter, hop forward and clean with some sweetness from the tropical fruit notes. Just awesome.

22 oz bomber. Tasted on 9/2/14. Beer from Moore Liquor. The beer has a great citrus aroma. Very different than any IPL or lager than I've tried. The taste is great with a citrus, resin & a clean floral notes. The clean finish rounds off a great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750ml bottle. Poured a golden color with a white head. Grassy, floral, some spicy hopiness, citrus, with a lighter toasted grainy and cookie dough.
Sweet start bitter finish. Imperial strong ipa. Gets better as it warms and 1/3 bottle drank.

Bottle - Pours golden with a thin ring of off-white head. Nose is a little sharp, with tropical fruit hops, onion/garlic, and pale malt. Grassy and bitter. Pretty bitter taste, with tropical fruit, dank onion/garlic, and pale dry malt. A little citrus, a little grass, and a little bitter. Medium-thin with mellow carbonation. Not terribly pungent or with that awesome lager graininess...just doesnt do it for me.
Nice hybrid ipa lager. Dark gold color. Aroma heavy with grapefruit and resin. Taste is sweet then resinous with a long lasting bitter finish. Clean lager-like mouthfeel. Very good.
Resin forward IPL. This is a DIPL if you will. Big, strong beer, differing from IPAs with an underlying smoothness, and from other IPLs in the bigness.

Great lager. Grassy up front, clean dry finish. Wonderful balance of hop flavor throughout. Doesnt taste boozy but the high ABV gives it depth. Pleasantly surprised by founders IPL. They should package this in a 16 oz can rather than a 24 oz bottle. High ABV lagers belong in cans.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2014 750ml bottle. Herbal, leafy, dank hop profile in the aroma, floral and lightly sweet with touches of peppery spice, grapefruit and lemon. Clear medium golden in color with a lasting, fine, white head and intricate lacing. Flavor is nicely hopped throughout with plenty of fresh, juicy citrus, faint pine, a touch of tropical fruit and herbal spice, along with a modicum of pale, gently sweet maltiness and finishing with a generous dose of resinous hop bitterness. Clean, moderately effervescent and lightly oily on the palate with a full body. Almost refreshing, in its way, particularly for a beer of this strength, and certain to satiate any hop craving.  
On a side note, this is the first of the Backstage Series that Ive actually been able to find easily and therefore purchase, and I have to think that the fact this is an IPL is the sole reason...

On tap at pro pig: Pours dark gold with a foamy white head and nice lacing. Aroma of pineapple, guava, and other tropical fruits. Taste is a little sweet up front, followed by tons of tropical fruit, balanced with a nice hops bite at the back end. Such a bright, clean beer. Medium body, bubbly mouthfeel, this is awesome.

Pours the exact color of beer with a nice white head, incredible. Aroma of citrus hops. Taste of an IPA with hops and bitterness. No alcohol tasted, maybe a bit of resin. Overall a good beer that thinks its a DIPA.

On tap at Easy Tiger Austin. Pours an IPA like copper color with nice fluffy white head. Aroma is nicely hoppy with grass, hints of pine and citrus notes. Light malt aromas of toast and grains. Taste is nice grassy / floral hops with pine notes and faint grapefruit. Balanced well with toasted malts and hints of grain. Palate is extremely smooth, medium body, medium carbonation. Very good. My first of this style.
bottle. golden with one finger head. very nice hop bomb. lots of pine and citrus. very solid ipl.

10 oz at Smoky Oak. Pours a pretty clear llight copper with a sparse head. Very hoppy nose leaning towards aggressive pine notes and a sharp citrus background. Plenty bitter flavor. Very clean and tasty, but I just feel like an ale yeast would be slightly better for a high alcohol hop bomb. The finish is all hops, dry and a little boozy. Pretty cool experiment.
On draft at isaacs. Nice nose of pine, floral hop and pine. Taste is grapefruit, bitter and floral hop, finish is pine. Well done.

22 oz bottle. Orange with a decent off-white head. Aroma is of orange, mango, lemon, passionfruit, light florals, and pineapple. Taste is of bitter florals, light pine, lots of citrus and tropical fruit.
Bottle. The look is clear, golden, beige colored head. The smell is fruity, hops, nice, grass, pine, and good. The taste is hoppy, fruits, pine, caramel, good.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2014 The beer pours a clear oange with a medium white head, and the aroma is quite hop forward (specific scents are resiny, floral, and piney) with an undercurrent of lager yeast and light malts. The flavor is mildly bitter and slightly sour, and the palate fuses an average carbonation, medium body, slick texture, and a slightly bitter finish. It generally doesnt taste like a lager.

August 30, 2014 - bottle from AV3. Clear orange pour with lots of head and some lacing. Aroma was grain, citrus and hops. Taste was consistent with aroma. Smooth and almost creamy with a mild bitter finish.  As this warmed, the sweetness came out to provide a bit more balance and really made this enjoyable.
Pours clear dark golden color with white head. Floral hop aroma with some toasted malt. Citrus and grassy hop flavors with some toasted malt and caramel. Medium body with average carbonation.

750 mL bottle from Beer Run, opened 8/13/14. Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a medium sized frothy off-white head. Good head retention. Aroma of toasted malt, caramel. floral and spicy hops. The taste is dry, toasted malt, caramel, citrus, earthy hops. Medium bodied, lingering bitterness.

Bottle. Pours a golden orange color with white head. Citrus, grapefruit, slight resiny aromas. Big orange, citrus, fruity hop, piney flavors. Very, solid balanced, flavorful beer. An interesting take on a hoppy lager that works well, and you dont really notice the alcohol.

Poured into a tulip out of a 750ml bottle.

Pours a hazy light gold with just a thin white head. Decent lacing, however and pretty good head retention.

Aroma is full of tropical fruit with lots of mango and tangerine. Some orange in there too along with pineapple. Not really any malt is detectable.

Flavor is very much like a double IPA. Lots of fruit and very juicy along with a high bitterness accompanying it all. Very clean flavor profile, though, letting you know this is not an ale. Just a touch of light bread with hops lingering through the finish.

Overall, the use of a lager yeast really lets the hops shine through without being muddled by any yeast esters. A clean mouthfeel and drier finish further help to show off the hops and increase drinkability. Very nice.

22oz bomber into a pilsner glass. I was totally surprised by this beer, it drinks like a DIPA. Color looks like a lager, pale golden yellow that is see through and foamy white head. Nose is floral, lemon lead citrus, and pine. Flavors follow the same profile with a faint yeast finish. Profile is big with hops and a crisp bitter finish leaving the palate dry.

750 ml bottle to snifter. Looks good for the style; a completely transparent golden orange with foamy eggshell head. Smells juicy and citrusy with loads of hops and soft notes of lager yeast. Tastes like it smells with a medium-bodied mouthfeel. A bit more bitter than juicy on the tongue. Good stuff.

Pours gold with a medium white head. Aroma is tropical with hints of pineapple and tangerine. The hop flavors hit you up front - they have an interesting depth to them. You really get the pineapple-like flavor with the addition of some melon. The finish is bitter, but very clean. Ive kind of abandoned lagers in the last few years, but I can honestly say that this is one of  the best lagered beers I have ever had. Hats off to Founders!
Pours a yellow orange color with a small soapy white head. Notes of lemon, brown sugar, citrus, hops, and cereal grains. Very well balanced with a good hop presence.
Bottle from Ribco, pours a bright gold with no head at all, aroma is grassy with some heavy hops coming through, flavor has a hop front end with a dry finish, decent but nothing crazy.

Tap. Poured clear copper color with an average frothy off-white head that was lasting and produced very good lacing. Good moderate citrus hop and complex malt aroma. Medium to abundant body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy bittersweet flavor with with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish of medium to long duration. This beer surpassed my expectations.
Pours a dark and clear gold. Has a strong floral hop and malt aroma. Taste is very hoppy with citrus, caramel, pine and malts. A lingering bitter aftertaste from the hops and malts.

Draft @ brewery. Sweet piney orange hops and caramel malt aroma. Clear golden yellow with a small white head. Sweet resinous piney orange hops, citrus peel and caramel malt flavor. Medium sticky body, soft carobnation.
Pours pale amber with a lasting white head. Taste is hoppy but mouthfeel is light. Finish is metallic. Interesting take on a lager.

I thoroughly enjoyed this beer. Aroma is surprisingly like tropical fruit. Color is golden with a medium beige head. Taste is quite sweet at first, then mostly pine, some citrus and a tiny bit floral hops come through. Well balanced, given the ABV. Excellent.

Gold, with substance. Very fruity aroma and the flavor is all apricot, all the time. If this ia what lagers tasted like, I would drink them, including the bitter finish but they would have to be half this strong because who drinks 9% beer and actually enjoys it?

750 ml. Pours clear, burnt orange-golden with a lasting spit of bubbles. Big nose of grapefruit, catspray, caramel and mint. Flavor leans to the grassy/minty/herbal side with some strong contribution from zesty citrus. An undercurrent of toasted cereal and honey cant keep the hops from getting out of hand. Long clean finish definitely showcases the bitter wooden, peppery-minty hops and magnifies the absence of enough malt to hold the whole thing up after 3-4 ounces. Medium body has a smooth, low-medium level of carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2015 From bomber. Pours a clear yellow with a small white head and almost no lacing. Aroma is huge citrus hops, a wonderful sweet hoppy smell. Taste has that, but is too bitter. Mouthfeel is thin but oily. Finish is bitter. Well made, but for me, a disappointment. Not as good as the score, not as good as the aroma, and not as good as Founders IPAs, which I love.

Sampled again. Flavor better than before. Score adjusted upwards 0.2

Bottle - Nice bright gold color with a dissipating head. Huge citrus aroma and sweet hop taste. Seems more bitter than the 70 IBUs Founders is claiming. Excellent beer. Does this brewery even make a bad beer?

Brilliant gold pour. Nose of catty pine and citrus with mild sticky malt. Flavor is herbal pine with a citrus finish. Good backing malt presence. Lingering dry pine. Definitely clean from the lager yeast, but doesnt make it any more or less approachable. Good, but nowhere near great.
On tap. Copper colour. Tropical fruit hop aroma and flavour, clean taste, bitter finish
I love this beer. Great aroma and taste. not too heavy and full of taste. Great stuff.
Shared bomber to dissenter glass. Delicious juicy hops and sweet malt in balance but with a clean lager taste.

Pours a nice darker gold color with minimal lacing. However, it smells of floral hops and tastes the same. Would almost not know it was an ipl rather than an ipa. A very good beer that I would get again in a heartbeat.
Clear orangish golden with a nice off white head. Lots of citrus aroma, some mango and grapefruit. Taste is initially quite sweet, follows with a medium bitterness. Citrus grapefruit hops. Nice

Bottle. Pours a clear yellow with a white head that lasts throughout the beer and laces. Aroma has a good amount of pine, lager yeast and grass with an earthy grain backbone. Flavor combines grain and pine with a lager yeast backing.
Bottle sample in R-Kansaw. Hazy straw color, fluffy white head. Aroma of very fruity fresh hay. Taste is fruity straw and hay. Very tasty.

Bottle from Blacklick Wine & Spirits. Clear gold pour with a medium off-white head. Aroma of grassy hops, tropical and citrus fruit, malt and lager yeast. Malty flavor with tropical fruit and onion accents before a bitter grapefruit finish.

On tap at Harris Grill. Pours a clear red-orange with a slight foamy white head. Aromas of citrus, mango, alcohol. Taste is sweet up front with a bitter finish. Syrupy mouth feel. Good, but a bit too intense for my tastes at this stage of the game.

On tap at TCT (Greenville, SC). 
Wonderful hoppy aroma: Fruity and herbal. 
Flavor îs milder than the aroma suggests, at least at first, with a solid light malt base. The finish and aftertaste had the hop power of an IPA.
Clear pale yellow, small foam head. Overwhelming bitter hop aroma and an even more allover present bitter taste. (Houston 201408)

Draft at pony bar HK. Pours a clear golden body with thin bubbly white lacing. Aroma is fruit - not sure what exactly. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of peach coming through followed by abrasive notes of alcohol, sweet malt, spice and floral character.  Too abrupt with the alcohol on the palate and in the finish, otherwise this could be an amazing and very interesting fruity/peachy/melon lager.

Bottle pour. Clean pear-gold with a white soapy head on the thin side. Solid lacing. Full, fresh nose. Lots of hops: pine, grass and a bomb of tropical fruit. Dry hopping shows nicely. Behind, you get lager yeast and dough. Everything fits together nicely. Medium body. Mild bitterness. Great extension of the tropical notes from the nose into the taste. Some sweetness offsetting contributed by the malts. Round flavors. Lingers nicely, with the grassy notes staying longest. More lager like this please. Great execution.

Clear, slightly pale gold with a few bubbles. Clean, fruity hops aroma; straw, citrus peel, tropical fruit. Full-bodied, dry taste with a bittering finish. Some resin, vegetable, bitter citrus flavors. Quite nice,

bottle from the Beer Dispensary Apex. Ok aroma, sweet. some citrus, pine, little doughy/bready. Clean golden orange color, ok head that faded to a ring, minor lacing. Sweet bitter flavor. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. Its ok, for me aroma not appealing, flavor little better, just ok in the scheme of things,
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Clear golden orange pour. Pine and grain in the aroma. Taste of pine, tropical fruit, malt and grain with nice bitterness. Pretty good.

Bottle from Brewfest Beverage, Ludlow, Vt. Clear gold with small head and lace. Grassy lemony crackery aroma. Mild crackery honey malts with assertive grapefruit rind bitterness that lingers. Some booze. Nice medium light body. Very good.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste pine, hops, citrus. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

750 ml bottle into a pint glass. Pours a clear dark amber with a finger of foamy white head. Nose is muted piney hops and some grass. Very faint fruit and booze. Taste is excessively bitter pine, floral hops, and some crisp crackery malts. Kind of boring. Overall its not a bad beer, its just nothing special. Which raises the question of why it is in the Backstage Series? Its not fresh and its a rather average attempt at the style, which is hilarious since I can get a four pack of Mass Rising which just kills this beer. I dont know Founders....I dont know....
8/20/2014. From bottle. Clear golden color with a white head. Floral hoppy aromas, similar to an IPA. Lots of hops, citrus, tropical fruit and light caramel flavors. Long hoppy finish.

Poured pale golden with nice white head. Wonderful tropical and piney bouquet. Great juicy hop aroma and taste. Clean clear tropical, fruity, hop taste. Somewhat bitter finish. This was refreshing and just awesome. Medium body. Just great
