Bottle @ home. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma is piney, fruity, sweet, citrus. Flavor is piney, crisp, sweet, citrus. Best IPL Ive had.
This poured a golden yellow color with a white head. Aroma was of fruits, grass and lemon. Flavor was clean pale malt, and fruity and resinous hops.

Draft. Clear apple juice body with medium off-white head. Aroma is moderately sweet, pine, some grapefruit, light lemon. Taste is moderately sweet, lemon, pine, some alcohol, caramel, light grapefruit. Medium body, some resin.
750 ml bottle at the DC Local Tasting. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of pine, floral notes, citrus. Tastes of pine, floral notes, citrus, hops. Medium body with a dry finish.

Draft at Good Dog. Deep gold pour with slim white foam. Feels like an overhopped Barleywine. Succulent blonde caramel. Rich amber fruit. Browned apricots. Quince. Sugared dandelions. Green peppercorns. Golden raisin bread. Pinecones. Kumquats. Reduced Chardonnay. Sweet, strong and spicy. Well developed. Quite potent. Quite good.

Sweet citrus hop smell as soon as I open the bomber. Appearance is golden yellow with white head. Little head retention. Taste is bitter up front, with some honey like sweetness. Very rounded and smooth, and not as agressive as I thought a beer of this gravity would be.

22 oz. bottle. Pours a medium golden pour with a white head. Aroma of pine, citrus, and tropical fruits. Some cracker malt. Flavor is bitter, hop forward, clean. Some sweetness imparted from the tropical fruit notes. Crisp mouthfeel with clean finish and lively carbonation. Overall, an incredible beer.

Bottle from WIneworks and shared with Adam. Aroma of resin, bright tart yellow grapefruit, and pine. Pours amber and beautiful with a medium foamy head. Taste is great with bitter pine and zesty grapefruit. Bitter taste and a forgivingly oily lager mouthfeel. Great lingering hop bitterness. Best IPL Ive had in a while. Damn good and underrated.

Very piney and wonderful overall. Pours golden with good head and lacing. Finishes with good dose of bitterness. Lots of citrus, with great balance. Everything I could want in an IPA and its a lager. Bottle thanks to someone at tasting.

Bottle. Pours golden with tall white frothy head. Aroma is bright, fresh hops. Tropical citrus and pine notes. Taste is similiar with lots of resinous "bite"; bitter finish. Smooth and interesting mouthfeel. Maybe a little higher on the IBUs than I like but a really crisp and tight beer.
pours an orange gold with a thick white head. Aroma of bitter citrusy hops, grapefruit and malt. Taste is bitter citrus, biscuit and sweet malt. medium body, creamy yet crisp. really nice!

22oz bottle pours a clear gold with some cloudy white head. Nose has some clean/bright pine, soap, a little rosemary, some orange. Flavor is clean citrus, pine sap, rosemary, grapefruit. Mellow finish.

Bottle (750 ml). Extra from gorgar, thanks! Clear bright golden/orange with a small mostly lasting white head and some lacing. Aroma is grassy with citrusy hops, pine, malt sweetness and light alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet and quite grassy with crisp malt, citrus, pine, light alcohol and light to moderate bitterness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Slightly oily mouthfeel. Dry finish. Clean. Quite easy to drink for an 8.7% abv beer, but I think it would still be better if it was a little lighter. Tasty. Good, but heavy pils.

8/17/14. 750mL bottle from Five Points. Very clear golden copper pour with a nice khaki head that cuts in half but sticks around and laces in mild webs. Big hop aroma, dank, grassy, and pine jumps to my nose at first followed by touches of citrus and tropical fruits and hints of crackers and sweet malts. Sweet hits me first, definitely malty, but then plenty of hop character comes through, lightly bitter, grassy and dank, some citrus and pit fruits, a lingering fresh hop kick and caramel remains on my tongue. Not bad, but some sweetness in there bugging me and I feel like I can sense the alcohol sitting on my tongue and lingering on my breath. Not bad.
Founders should make more lager. Smooth and round, with heft and length on the palate, the soft malts are exceeded by bitter fruit, lupulin, fermenting pine. Great beer. Some spice on the finish.

a new beer from founders, sure Ill give it a shot (despite the oversized bottle and oversized pricetag). IPL seems really to be taking off these days so hopefully this one does the style justice. it pours out a nice gold with a whitish head and a good amount of citrus and pine aroma. some pilsner notes, which are differentiated from a similarly hopped pale ale by the flakier malt aromas and cleaner yeast profile. this is a very nice brew, inheriting all the best character from its constituent styles and does well enough to mask a big alcohol presence.
Golden colored pour. Small white head. Little bit of lacing. Huge piney hop aroma. Taste is bitter hops and slight caramel.
Dark gold, nice white head. Big piney hop aromas up front. Taste is more piney hops, smooth viscous malts and a very dry finish. Pretty enjoyable, actually. Would drink again...
Rosehips, lillies, caramel aroma. Clear golden, thin head. Honey, grass, and lillies on the palate. Oily. Well hopped. A lot of flavor packed into a lager. Pretty nice!

Pours a clear bright yellow gold with white head. Some light hop resin, cereal grain, and some floral notes on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes quick and clean. Nice to see a lager coming out on the market, seems that lagers are getting to be a forgotten style, and this is a great example of how tasty lagers can be when properly done.
A clear golden beer with a small white head. The aroma is light grain and floral hops. The flavor is bready, hay, lightly bitter and a strong alcohol presence.

Brilliant clear gold pour some head, quick decending lace. Hoppy aroma fruit floral.Quite pungent really. Smooth taste, hoppy, smooth rich malt, light butter carmel sweetness smooth bitter pine. Light butter/caramel sweet notes with dry toasty malt, some breadyness. Good example of the style. Hard to tell its a lager because of abv other than some cleaner/smoother character.

Poured from bomber into pilsner/ lager glass. Clear gold with creamy white head that sticks around. Smell is dominated by floral and fruity hops. Taste has some fruitiness up front, with some lager-y malt and a more bitter finish. Medium body with proper carbonation. Overall a pretty tasty beer. The balance isnt the best, but I like he combo of flavors.

Bottle from shelf. The way ths one is selling around here, it might end up being another bolt cutter...
Pours a clear orange with a small white head. Aromas of tropical fruit from an enormous dry hop apparently. Or maybe its the cleaner lager yeast that lets the aroma shne through. Either way, its fruity and juicy. Nice. 
Taste is mildly bitter with a nice sweetness that is not out of place. Flavor has a very nice tropical fruit hop expression, with a clean malt presence and a touch of residual sugar. Medium bitterness, but this beer is on par with some of the "next level beats" type dipas like Sosus and alpine duet. Pretty tropical, slightly syrupy and really just clean and flavorful overall. This is way better than I thought it would be. Really.
22 ounce bottle. Pours a beautiful clear bright gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, topical, pine, and malt. Taste is grapefruit, lemon, pineapple, pine, and malt. Very hop forward.
750ml bottle. Poured a clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma was malty, lager yeast, plenty of hops. Flavor was hops. Lager notes, yeast. Pretty good.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2014 Sampled on draft at Hou Thou this beer poured a golden amber color with a medium sized creamy yellow-white head that left good lacing. The aroma was tangy and sweet sugar, caramel, pine, grapefruit, perfume, catbox and tropical fruits. The flavor was tangy and bitter with bread, sugar, pine, tropical fruits, grapefruit and a bit of catbox. Long finish. Thick body. Interesting.
From a 22 oz bottle courtesy of Ryan, Pours a clear gold with a thick off white head. Fruity nose. Flavors of grapefruit and biscuit. Bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours clear gold, big white head, some retention/lace. Aroma of tropical, citrus, melon hop, bread, cracker. Taste is moderately bitter, fruity, tropical, grain, bread. Palate is soft, slick, bitter finish. Good stuff.

750 ml bottle. Bright yellow gold color. Small foamy white head. Fragrant citrus hop aroma. Soft bittersweet toasted malt flavor is balanced nicely by the big citrusy hops. For such a big beer this very smooth and drinkable. Slightly bready but lots of complex hops. Finish brings notes of vanilla and caramel, then bitter and dry. Well done.

Bottle from Savor Growl. Yellow pour with with head. Aroma of pine, herbal. Tastes are zesty, juicy citrus, pale malt, grass, pepper, little wood. Really nice. Not sure what style this is, but its good.

On tap at Founders. The pour is a great reddish orangey color with a light rim of head that disappears quickly leaving no lace. The aroma is quite citrusy with a good presence of hops, but then a little bready which is where the lager takes over. The flavor is great. There is a nice balance of citrus and a good bready malt. The hops are a little overshadowed, but offer a light bitterness. The mouth feel is a bit thin and the carbonation isn't what I was expecting for a lager. The aftertaste is dry, lingeringly a little hoppy and pretty good

2013 bottle. Bright and clear light copper with an off-white head. Aroma is candied orange, mango and light phenol. Taste is slightly medicinal with a little citrus and an astringent bitterness. Pretty complex for a lager.

Pours a clear light golden with a nice white head that settles to a film and has good lacing.  Aroma is somewhat floral with some mango, citrus and slight aspirin.  Taste has a bit of sweetness with a grapefruit bitterness, some dankness and a chalkiness when it warms.  Finishes dry with a growing bitterness.  Medium bodied with moderate/high carbonation.  Well made with good hop flavor.

Golden color with a smattering of white head on the surface. Smells of caramel malt, grass, some dankness, a slight funky smell, floral, medicine. Taste is sweet floral, honey biscuit, mild hop bitter in the finish, grass, pine and some sweetness in the form of caramel malt. I'm not sure there's much difference from an IPA and an IPL but still pretty good beer.

Fairly modest appearance: gold color with small, yet well-retained and well-laced, head. Aroma: pine and lots and lots of citrus. Big juicy citrus. Flavor: big juicy citrus. Lots of booze. Clean finish of a lager; much less heavy and sugary than a double IPA. If only the booze were better-hidden - it competes too much with the big juicy citrus. A little harsh. Still, recommended.

750 mL bottle from Total Wine, Chesapeake, VA. Yellowish-orange pour with a frothy white head. Bright pineapple and tangerine hop aroma. The taste offers plenty of bitter citrus and pine hops with a well-balanced sweet malt backbone. I would have a hard time distinguishing this from an IPA. Very well done.

Aroma is amazing. Creamy citrusy. Grapefruit. Honey. Pine.Looks nice. Clean medium amber. Nice lacing. Taste is a quick bit of those citrus notes then hops hops hops. Piney. Earthy. Lingering. Aggressive. Hops are overly bitter and linger too long on the palate. Body is medium. Carb is perfect. Overall this might as well be an IPA. The potential synergy between the crispness of the lager and the hop notes is not taken advantage of as the hops overpower just about everything here. Some good flavor notes and an ok pallet make this beer solidly ok. The palate really knocks it down.

Aroma is hops, more citrus and pine, bitter. Appearance is yellow like apple juice, clear, white head. Taste is malty then hoppy, significant lager characteristics perked by a hop bomb. Mouthfeel is decent, what youd expect from an IPA. Overall, not big on lager beer but this is still very good.

Clear gold pour with a white head. Big bitter beer. Its almost as if their goal was to make a crazy bitter IPL. The malt bill is noticeable but the bitterness overshadows all. Some grassy flavors dance around. Tasty beer but a bit over the top.

750 ml bottle into lager glass; no bottle dating, but was just released. Pours crystal clear pale golden color with a 1 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass. Aromas of big tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, lemon zest, apricot, floral, grass, pine, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity of bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate pale malt balance; with great strength. Taste of big tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, lemon zest, apricot, floral, grass, pine, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Good amount of earthy pine/grassy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, lemon zest, apricot, pine, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity of bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate pale malt sweetness; with a nice malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and moderately sticky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent IPL. All around great complexity and balance of citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate pale malt sweetness; and very smooth and crisp to drink for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

This hoppy lager rocks! Very heavy hop presence all the way to the finish. I expected to taste some malt, being that it is a lager, but the only characteristic I can find is a bit of sweetness at the end, which rounds it out perfectly. Highly recommended if you can get hands on it.

Nice golden color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of malt, rich pine hops, floral, & citrus; Flavor of slight sweet malt, caramel, pine hops, & citrus; Finish is crisp & fairly bitter; Nicely balanced; I enjoyed this one - Good!

Pours gold into a snifter. Bright white head with medium retention recedes leaving spider lacing. Sweet caramel and tropical fruit aromas. Well balanced with caramel and resin upfront turning dry and slick in the lasting bitter earth, sweet grass and pith finish.

Truly an awesome beer, reminds me a lot of what Jacks Abby is doing with the IPL style. Amazing clarity, crisp, beautifully hopped with pine and grapefruit aromas billowing from the glass. ABV is well hidden because its so smooth. This should become a yearly release.

750 ml bottle. Pours a clear bright golden yellow color with sparkling white head that fades quickly to nil. Aroma is corn and grass from lager yeast, with an angry dank bitter hop character fighting to be involved. Overall, the aroma is muted yet crisp. Flavor is hop bitterness, a vegetal grassy quality, and a certain dank quality that ties everything together. Thin bodied, active champagne-like carbonation.
Clear golden color. Wonderfully firm body for a lager. Hop aroma and taste mixed fruity and herbal. Surprising little alcohol in bitter aftertaste.

750ml bottle. Very light smell, vague fruitiness. Flavor takes a LONG time to get going, just not vibrant. To me its a miss. Suprised at the high scores. This bottle wasnt as expensive as others in the series and I thankfully got a pour from my roommate but I think the price is affecting the score once again. Just put it in fuckin 14$ 4 packs and be done with it.
750ml bottle pours a clear yellow with an off white head. Citrus orange and tropical fruit taste

Shared with the wife who had nothing but praises for this. I was skeptical months ago but at the end of the day Founders just does me way more good than bad. Citrus and tropical fruit dominate the smooth thicker lager palate of bready malts. Some fruitiness from the yeast. Would love to have this is a smaller package format as an everyday type drinker. Really nice though.

Poured in my snifter as a dark pale yellow color. Light head with nice lacing. Very grassy up front, lots of pine and some dank notes. Very bitter on the palate but also very nice. The alcohol doesn't come through until the after taste, which I like. I love the intensity of this beer, but still a calm beer. I enjoyed this a lot!

Bottle pour light yellow. Nose grassy, pine,and some dank. Taste aroma comes through in the flavor. Bitter hop and aromatics up front. Mid palate smooth malt. Late palate mild heat from the alcohol. Bitter finish with some lingering grassy hop.

On tap at Rare Bird in Traverse City. Pours golden with a white head. Lots of pine hoppiness in the aroma and some citrus hoppiness. Flavors of pine, grapefruit, pine resin hoppiness. I wrote "very hops" in my notebook.

Bottle poured a deep golden color with a thin coating of white head. Aroma has bright hops, citrus, pine, sweet fruit, and a poke of alcohol. Mouth feel is full for the style and there is medium low carbonation. Flavor gets some bitterness kicking, pine, resins, dry citrus, perfume, and some alcohol on the finish. This is really in ipa territory with hops at a tuned up level though there are lager malts at the core. I guess it is yet another direction for the backstage series and the lack of barrel aging brings this to a more realistic price point.

Bottle. Clear golden yellow pour, very light/spotty carbonation and an aroma of orange/lemon hops. Flavor is also light citrusy hops, some sweet malty honey and a bit of noticeable alcohol. Not bad at all, but not worth $11/bottle.

Served on tap in a snifter
 Appearance  The brew is served a clear light golden color with a thick one finger white head that has fantastic retention. The head slowly fades over a long time to leave a good level of lacing on the sides of the glass.
 Smell  The aroma of the brew is heaviest of sweeter tropical fruits of tangerine, mango and pineapple. Along with these aromas some nice bits of a grapefruit hop and a good deal of a bready and malty smell. Some lighter hoppy smells of a pine and herbal smell are there as well rounding out the aroma nicely.
 Taste  The taste begins with a slightly caramel and fruit sweetened very bready flavor with a good deal of a grapefruit hop flavor present upfront. The taste is drier then would have been expected from the nose with it only getting even drier as the taste advances. Some flavor of a pine and earthy hop nature come to the tongue more toward the middle and toward the end. With a little bit of booze, some grass, and a slight piney flavor coming to the tongue more toward the end, mixing with the other flavors and al tiny bit of booze, to leave one with a rather crisp, but rather potently hopped and malty flavor to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the slightly thicker and creamier side with a carbonation level that is a bit higher. The mix of thicker body, which is nice for the hop and bready, and the higher carbonation which is nice of the more lager characteristics of the brew, produces a feel that is overall quite nice for the tastes of the beer.
 Overall  A quite enjoyable and robust IPL. Crisp and refreshing as a lager should be, but nicely hoped as a double imperial should be. Rather well done.

Bottle pours a clear golden with a large off-white head. Strong floral tropical citrus hop aroma. Initial taste is similar to aroma, well rounded fruity sweetness, graham cracker malt, with a slight but clean bitter finish, some minerals. Nice!
Drought. Slightly cloudy rich yellow with creamy off-white head, floral hops aroma, very well-balanced sweetish hoppy taste, low carbonation, long finish. Very smooth hoppiness!

Pours a clear golden with a medium white head...nice lacing. Aroma has nice floral hop notes that run the gamut...grass, citrus, spice. Flavor follows suit...delicate, hoppy and very floral and flavorful. Mouthfeel is surprisingly light and the finish is crisp, clean, and lingering with awesome hoppiness.

Draft at Edmunds Oast. Clear golden pour with a small white head. Big, clean tropical and stone fruit nose with hints of fresh cut flowers. Clean, bright and bold hop character throughout the mouth which leads to a dry, bitter finish. One of the best for this "style".
Pours a hazy light golden color. Aroma and taste are floral and citrus hops.

bottle. crystal clear pale gold with a large, whipped, white head. straw and floral hop aroma with light colored fruits. hoppy with white grapefruit and melons. very clean. slurpy lager-like texture. weird ass label. leaves a berry/melony aftertaste.

Crystal clear golden coloured body with a large, three centimetre tall white head makes for a nice look to the style. Aroma of very fresh hops, alcohol, light metal, but more pine and grapefruit notes make this very nice. Medium-bodied; Tastes of pine, flowers, resin, grapefruit and especially herbs show the hop profiles throughout, but the last, grassy and very herbal note make this one stand out for quite a while in the palate. Aftertaste shows a great blend of malt and hops with more of an emphasis on the hops, but a flavour-packed and still complex beer, especially for the style. Overall, definitely worth finding if you can grab it somewhere, but otherwise, a hop-forward lager makes for a nice beer, but nowhere near the depth or complexity of most ales. I sampled this 75 cL bottle purchased the day before at Whole Foods in Vienna, Virginia on my fifth wedding anniversary on 09-August-2014 for US$12,99 sampled at home in Washington on 10-August-2014.

Bottle.
Glass: Tired Hands wine glass.
Appearance: The body is clear with a vibrant golden-orange hue. A dense and rocky head sits on top shortly, forming an opaque white frothy coating.
Aroma: The aroma is bright and fruity with tangerine and bitter orange being prominent with honey and hints of sweet malt in the background.
Taste: The intro is clean and quick, leading to a malty and bitter mid-taste hinting at honey and bitter orange along with mango. The bitterness is a bit rough, like chewing on grapefruit rind. The finish is sort of seltzer water like with an earthy bitter finish that lingers.
Palate: Full-bodied, a bit oily and thick, with mild to moderate carbonation.
Overall: I liked this a lot initially, but something about the bitterness is making this just decent to me. Its sort of an abrasive beer, tasting a bit unrefined. Its a good beer, definitely worth checking out, but I wouldnt buy this again.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Kevin. Clear, beaming golden color with a soapy, foamy white head that sifts nicely on top as a mild film & chunky collar. Aroma of mild citrus, candied grapefruit, hints of floral hops, light herbal & pepper notes, a touch of pale malt, & faint sugar cookie. Smells like Centennial. Taste is the same way... Candied grapefruit peel with little sprinkles of white pepper, orange rind, some mild sugary pale malts, with a moderately herbaceous back-end. Some spicy, herbal earth notes, lightly floral leafy finish. Nothing about this reminds me of a lager, but its a pretty solid beer nonetheless.

Bottle: The aroma consists grapefruit, pine, light dank notes, and a hint of fruit. It pours a transparent gold with a small white head that quickly fades to a thin soapy ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of tropical fruits and citrus. The finish has moderate grapefruit, light pine, and a hint of dankness. Its light-medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, slightly hazy orange pour with white, lacing head, aroma brought notes of orange peel, lemon, grass, herbal notes with a hint of biscuity, bready notes, some nice piney notes as well, basically smells like an IPA. Taste brings notes of lemongrass, orange, grapefruit, some white fruit into a bit of goopy/syrupy malt with some yeasty spice, some pine, finishing fairly bitter, slightly sweet, mouthfeel does not work but the tastes are solid.

Bottle. The pour is light and bright. The aroma is subtle hops. The taste is mild, kinda boring. Not a lot of ipl's out there, but this is far from my favorite.

Yup, this worked. Growler fill from Whole Foods. Poured a very lightly hazy gold, good head. Aroma is hoppy, loads of floral and slightly citric notes, but not coming across as particularly "American" in character. Flavor is honey accented granola malt and a burst of spicy and floral hops. Medium to full bodied. Really nice.
Very tropical and citrusy hop aromas, and faint grain. Clear, bright gold with a lasting white head. Bitter with refreshing fruity hop flavors. Light-medium bodied, great carbonation.
Aromas of fresh fruity hop aromas and some sweet caramel. Foamy off white head and darker golden body. Fresh dry hop flavors some crisp tropical fruits. Crisp and dry on the palate.
Beautiful golden color. Aromas of citrus, lemon, pine, grass, hops. Crisp, slightly spicy, clean.
Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours a transparent golden with a thin ring of off white head. Aroma of malts and lots of lemons. Taste of malts, some hoppiness, more of that lemon peel.

Pours a nice golden color with two fingers of fluffy white foam. Nose is a nice punch of citrus forward hop aromas with nuances of tropical fruit and dank pine. Palate is softer than the nose lead me to expect but still hop forward with nice citrus and tropical fruit on the front end that turns a bit earthy and spicy with a bitter pine finish. Solid offering but would rather drink it by the 4pk for $10 than a 750ml for $11.
Amber with rimming beige head; aroma is of fresh Christmas trees; Flava is of line balanced subtly with malty sweetness; feels thick foamy luscious; finishes grainy hoppy malty perfect mild blend
Bottle from Binnys Southloop. Poured amber yellow with decent. Aroma dank citrus hop. Light carb med bod. Light resin grass funk.

Bottle. Golden yellow pour with a small foamy head that fades to a thin layer and leaves nice lacing. Aromas are tropical fruit, sweet malt, and light spruce. Tastes kinda juicy with a moderate sweetness. Light bitterness in the finish. Tropical fruit and orange peel mostly with some light pine and spruce in the finish. Medium body. Nice mouthfeel. Crisp lager finish. Really enjoyed this but did this really have to be a Backstage Series beer? Why not put this in 4-pks?

750 ml bottle. Served in a pilsener glass, the beer pours a mostly clear gold color with a half inch white head. Head retention is good, and theres a decent amount of lacing. The brew smells like citrusy hops (tropical fruit, grapefruit, orange peel), grassy hops, and some bready/grainy malt. Taste is pretty much just like the aroma, but with the addition of some pine hops, light floralness and melon. Mouthfee/body is medium, its smooth and a bit creamy with moderate carbonation. I think its a good brew, certainly worth a try. $11.99 a bottle.
At Justins house warming party. Aroma smooth cat urine, mosaic hops. Taste is light, mosaic, crisp, very dry, grainy.

Bottle to glass. Pours a clear golden yellow color with an off-white head. Aroma packs a punch of citrusy, fleshy fruit, hoppy goodness. Flavor is full of fleshy fruit hops with a light background of lager characteristics. Light to medium in body with a delicious lingering fruity hoppy bitter sweetness. Im not a huge fan of lagers, but this one hides it well. Phenomenal beer! Although, I have come to expect nothing less from Founders.
750 ml bottle. Pours a clear deep gold with a medium white head. Aroma of faint tropical fruit, citrus and hops. Taste of faint grapefruit, hops and tropical fruit notes. Very good.

I like this! Hoppy, nice citrus, clean body with some heft. The head and lacing are quintessential lager. Nice!

750ml bottle thanks to my boy Scott from an unnamed store that hooks me up time and time again with the harder to get bottlles, thanks bro. Poured a super clean and clear deep gold body with an average foamy white head. Bottle from the store. Nose is wicked citrus. Very orange-y. Pour is crystal clear and light orange. Taste is citrus and bitter all over the place. Very good. No sign of alcohol.

Bottleshare thanks to Homer! Pours a golden color with white head. Aroma is hoppy, pine, trees. Taste is light, smooth, piney, a tad sweet too, malty. After taste sticks around a bit. I think its tasty.
Bottle: pours golden amber with a thin white head, aroma is mildly hoppy, has enough hops that it would be easy to think this is an IPA, not overly bitter, smooth finish. Very nice.
Bomber thanks to respertftw. Clear GD with an off white head. Smells like a citrusy IPA. IPA upfront with a sticky, wheaty finish.

Pour on tap at Coopers Tavern. Splt with nuplastikk. Clear orange color. Thin white head. Leaves great, thicker lace. Wow, great big hoppy nose on this guy. Up front in the smell, an impressive level of west coast IPA style hops. Big resin, citrusy hop on this. And the flavor is very on the mark, very convincingly DIPA. Would never guess it was a lager. But I can kind of see the influence, if I think about it. Medium body. Smooth, kind of crisp, lighter carbonation. Light slick finish. Moderate to bigger bitter taste, light to moderate sweet. Light hint of warmth on the end, appropriate for the ABV. Pretty impressive hoppy DIPL. Well-done; impressive. As good as the best examples of the style. Pretty damn good, drinkable, refreshing IPL. Bottles from Capones and Frank Smiths. Pours clear, bright golden with 1-finger frothy white head. Nose is great: a huge medley of pale malt, juicy hops, tangerine, mango, honeydew, black pepper. UPDATED: AUG 18, 2014 Ive recently started trying this style more, and Im finding that I really enjoy it. I was not overly excited when I heard about this release, but after having a few on draft, all I have to say is WOW! 

The aroma is citrus, tropical and a hint of piney earthyness. 
The taste is just like the nose citrusy, tropical with grapefruit taking the main stage on my palate. Im getting so much grapefruit I cant believe they didnt add any to the beer. Its just spectacular.
The finish is very clean, as youd expect with a lager. No lingering bitterness at all.
For 8.7% abv, its extremely well hidden. No residual alcohol burn at all. In fact the finish leaves me craving another sip immediately.

I really hope more breweries take a stab at this style. Although other than Jacks Abby, I dont think anyone can possible top this beer. Well done Founders!

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2014 Pours a clear yellow from the bottle with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave light lace. Aroma is big on the citrus and sweet hops, almost strawberry pineapple. Gold pour with a small white head. Aroma of floral hops, orange candies, toffee. Goopy, bitter on the palate. A touch rough for sure. Nice floral hop. Some majorly chewy earthy bitterness. Bottle. Gold with a white head. Citrus hop aroma with bread. The taste adds some pine and light sweet grassy malts. Excellent smooth mouthfeel. Very easy to drink. Perfect representation of the style.

Bottle from Berts
Pours a slightly hazy deep straw color with a huge tightly bubbled white head that shows moderate retention and some sticky lace. Aromas of sour pink grapefruit some pine and resin with a hint of menthol and mint. Very faint crackery malt deep underneath. The flavor is intense sour grapefruit with hints of pine resin and earth. The finish has a big caramel blast and then resiny hops stay in the mouth. Excellent, probably the best big hoppy lager Ive had.

Crisp and crazily hoppy! This is definitely the best lager I have ever had. Not a lot of beer can quench your thirst and explode your taste buds with next level hop attitude. They should make this all the time, because I would buy it all the time!

Draft at Clinton hall NYC. Pours a hazy tan color. Rich with citrus , fruits and tang. Goes down easy for the abv. Decent
Pours clear golden with thin head. Smells of hops, sweet fruit, and floral. Full bodied but not heavy on the palate. Nice dry bitterness with clean finish.
750 ml bottle. Clear orange color. Huge hop aroma and taste. Bitter followed by tropical fruit. Very nice. Very clean.

Had this at the Great Arkansas Beer Festival 2014. Pours a clear pale yellow. Some floral on the nose. Some citrus also. Hay. Somewhat thick mouthfeel. Finishes crisp and clean. Very nice beer.
